marketNews.title: Government Plans to Extend Credit Restructuring Relaxation Until 2025
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that President Joko Widodo requested the relaxation of credit restructuring for Covid-19 affected parties to be extended until 2025. This plan is intended to reduce the burden on the banking industry in provisioning for losses due to failures in paying People's Business Credit (KUR). Airlangga mentioned that this proposal will be followed up through the Financial System Stability Committee (KSSK) and the Governor of Bank Indonesia. Responding to this proposal, the Chairman of the OJK Board of Commissioners, Mahendra Siregar, stated that his party will take steps to deepen and evaluate the credit restructuring program that has been running. The relaxation of credit restructuring for Covid-19 affected parties began in March 2020 and was supposed to end in March 2024. Although its validity period has ended, OJK still allows banks to continue with restructurings that are already in process. With the end of the relaxation, restructured credits that are still problematic will no longer be categorized as smooth (lancar), but will shift to the problematic category. Consequently, banks must bear the provisioning cost (cost of credit) to form reserves against these problematic loans. Here is a summary of the development of credit restructuring affected by Covid-19: [Image data snippet]. Key Takeaway: We assess that if this proposal is implemented, it can have a positive impact on bank net profit in the short term due to the reduction in provisioning costs resulting from the recategorization of problematic loans. On the other hand, if the restructured loans do not improve, this policy in the long run will only delay the categorization of non-performing loans.

marketNews.title: Presidential Staff Office Predicts Rice Deficit in July 2024
marketNews.content: Deputy III of the Presidential Staff Office, Edy Priyono, stated that his office predicts Indonesia will experience a rice deficit in July 2024 due to the decline in national production. Edy noted that national rice production during 4M24 decreased by -20.9% YoY to reach 10.27 million tons.

marketNews.title: Trade Minister Announces Price Hike for Minyakita Cooking Oil
marketNews.content: Minister of Trade, Zulkifli Hasan, stated that the Highest Retail Price (HET) for Minyakita will increase next week from 14,000 Rupiah per liter to 15,700 Rupiah per liter, which is higher than the initial plan that intended the increase to 15,500 Rupiah per liter.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Governor Sees No Urgent Need for Rate Hikes to Stabilize Rupiah
marketNews.content: Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, stated in a joint meeting with the DPR on Monday (24/6) that the central bank does not see an urgent need to raise the benchmark interest rate at this time to stabilize the Rupiah exchange rate. This is based on inflation being relatively low, and a further interest rate hike would negatively impact economic growth. Perry also stated that the BI is optimistic that the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar will strengthen towards its fundamental level below 16,000.

marketNews.title: State Budget Records IDR 21.8 Trillion Deficit as of May 2024
marketNews.content: Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated that the 2024 State Budget recorded a deficit of 21.8 trillion Rupiah or 0.1% of GDP as of May 2024. This result was driven by state revenue falling by -7.1% YoY to 1,123.5 trillion Rupiah, equivalent to 40.1% of the 2024 State Budget target, following a decline across all state receipt posts. Meanwhile, state expenditure realization increased by +14% YoY to 1,145.3 trillion Rupiah, equivalent to 34.4% of the 2024 State Budget target.

marketNews.title: World Bank Recommends Lowering Corporate Tax Threshold
marketNews.content: The World Bank advised the Indonesian government to lower the corporate tax threshold to boost state revenue. The World Bank Chief Economist, Habib Rab, stated that the tax threshold for corporations in Indonesia is currently 6 times higher compared to OECD countries. The Director at the Directorate General of Taxes, Dwi Astuti, said that this proposal is currently being discussed internally.

marketNews.title: Eramet and BASF Cancelboard Nickel Smelter JV Investment in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Eramet and BASF SE announced that they will cancel the joint venture investment for a nickel smelter worth 2.6 billion US dollars in Weda Bay. BASF SE told Bloomberg that they no longer see the necessity for the investment due to the increasing availability of global electric battery supply.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Chairman Suggests 35% Stake Divestment in Trans-Java Toll Road Next Week
tickerNews.content: JSMR: Chairman of Metro Pacific Tollways Corp. (MPTC), Manuel V. Pangilinan, stated that his company will sign the acquisition transaction for a 35% stake in PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol (JTT) next week. Manuel did not specify the total value of the transaction. However, MPTC - which is the parent of Nusantara Infrastructure (META) controller - last year estimated that its joint venture with GIC Pte. Ltd. would invest 600 million US dollars or 9.78 trillion Rupiah to acquire the 35% stake in JTT.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Major Shareholder Transfers Ownership Proportionally to Shareholders
tickerNews.content: AMMN: PT Alpha Investasi Mandiri, holding 5.16 billion shares (7.11%) of Amman Mineral Internasional, transferred its entire ownership in AMMN proportionally to its shareholders consisting of Alexander Ramlie, Thomas Ramlie, and Charles Daniel Gobel on July 25, 2024. Alexander Ramlie - who is the President Director of AMMN - then transferred all shares he received, amounting to 5.13 billion shares (7.08%) of AMMN, to foreign companies he controls, including Sajir 9 LLC, Miracle Milestone Ltd., and Fennel Field LLC. All transactions were conducted at a price of 1,695 Rupiah per share. This transaction is intended for estate planning and does not constitute a sale of shares to a third party.

tickerNews.title: TOTL Maintains 2024 New Contract Value Target Despite Strong Mid-June Performance
tickerNews.content: TOTL: Investor Relations for Total Bangun Persada, Kevin Alexander, stated that the company has recorded new contract value of 3.3 trillion Rupiah up to mid-June 2024, equivalent to 94.2% of the 2024 target of 3.5 trillion Rupiah. TOTL has no plans to raise the 2024 new contract value target.

tickerNews.title: CLPI Agrees to Distribute 2023 Dividend of IDR 128.25 per Share
tickerNews.content: CLPI: Colorpak Indonesia will distribute 2023 fiscal year dividends amounting to 39.3 billion Rupiah or 128.25 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 75% dividend payout ratio. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is July 3, 2024, while payment is scheduled for July 26, 2024. Referring to CLPI's stock price on Tuesday (25/6) at 1,180 Rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 10.9%.

tickerNews.title: CAMP to Distribute 2023 Dividend of IDR 20 per Share
tickerNews.content: CAMP: Campina Ice Cream Industry will distribute 2023 fiscal year dividends amounting to 117.7 billion Rupiah or 20 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 92.36% dividend payout ratio. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is July 1, 2024, while payment is scheduled for July 25, 2024. Referring to CAMP's stock price on Tuesday (25/6) at 414 Rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 4.8%.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Subsidiary Expects Arrival of 12 New Ship Sets from Order of 15 Sets
tickerNews.content: TPMA: Director of Trans Power Marine, Rudy Sutiono, stated that the company's subsidiary, PT Trans Logistik Perkasa, will receive 12 new ship sets out of the 15 sets previously ordered. The total cost for these 12 ship sets reaches 50 million US dollars. However, Rudy did not specify when these ships would arrive and become operational.

tickerNews.title: GOTO President Director Increases Stake to 0.03% After Buying 98.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: GOTO: President Director of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia, Sugito Walujo, purchased 98.5 million GOTO shares at a price of 51 Rupiah per share on June 20, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 5 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Sugito Walujo's ownership in GOTO increased from 0.02% to 0.03%.

tickerNews.title: TAPG Establishes Joint Venture with Aisin Takaoka for Bio-coke Production
tickerNews.content: TAPG: Triputra Agro Persada announced the establishment of a joint venture with Aisin Takaoka Co. Ltd. to produce bio-coke based on palm kernel shells. The joint venture company is targeted to commence production in 2H25.

tickerNews.title: AGII New Factory to Operate in Q3 2024; Dividend Yield Indicated at 0.6%
tickerNews.content: AGII: President Director of Samator Indo Gas, Rachmat Harsono, stated that the new factory in the Batang Integrated Industrial Estate will officially operate in August or September 2024. This factory will be AGII's 56th air separation plant and is the plant with the largest production capacity for the company. In a separate occasion, AGII will distribute 2023 fiscal year dividends amounting to 10.8 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 20% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 0.6% as of Tuesday (25/6).

tickerNews.title: NFCX Subsidiary Acquires 50% Stake in Infi Asia E-Mobility Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: NFCX: NFC Indonesia, through its subsidiary PT Energi Selalu Baru (ESB), announced the acquisition of a 50% stake in Infi Asia E-Mobility Pte. Ltd. with an undisclosed transaction value. This move is aimed at accelerating ESB's expansion into key Southeast Asian markets, including Thailand, Malaysia, and Vietnam. ESB is the producer of the Volta brand electric motorcycle. As of 1Q24, ESB has facilitated over 665,000 battery swapping transactions through 299 swapping stations.
